official-title.#text:
To require 85 percent domestic content in green
		  technologies purchased by Federal agencies or by States with Federal funds and
		  in property eligible for the renewable energy production or investment tax
		  credits.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in addition to the
			 Committee on
committee-name.#text:
Committee
			 on Oversight and Government Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the
			 Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the
			 jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Make it in America: Create Clean
			 Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requirements for
			 purchase of green technologies with 85 percent domestic content for use by
			 Federal Government and States

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, only green technologies that are 85 percent manufactured in
			 the United States, from articles, materials, or supplies 85 percent of which
			 are grown, produced, or manufactured in the United States, may be acquired for
			 use by the Federal Government.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: Notwithstanding

header.#text:
Requirement for
			 purchases by Federal Government

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, Federal funds may not be provided to a State for the purchase of green
			 technologies unless the State agrees that the funds shall be used to purchase
			 only green technologies that are 85 percent manufactured in the United States,
			 from articles, materials, or supplies 85 percent of which are grown, produced,
			 or manufactured in the United States.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: Subject to

header.#text:
Requirement for
			 purchases by States using Federal funds

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act/s:2/ss:a
Make it in America: Create Clean Energy Manufacturing Jobs in America Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text:
During the first two fiscal years occurring after the
			 date of the enactment of this Act,

during the first
			 fiscal year beginning after such date of enactment, by substituting

during the second
			 fiscal year beginning after such date of enactment, by substituting

term.#tail:
means renewable energy and energy
			 efficiency products and services that—

text.#text:
In this
			 Act, the term

reduce dependence
			 on unreliable sources of energy by encouraging the use of sustainable biomass,
			 wind, small-scale hydroelectric, solar, geothermal, and other renewable energy
			 and energy efficiency products and services; and

use hybrid
			 fossil-renewable energy systems.

This section shall apply to purchases of green technologies
			 on and after October 1 of the first fiscal year beginning after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.

header.#text:
Renewable energy
			 production and investment tax credits limited to domestically produced
			 property

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subsection (d) of section 45 of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text:
Credit for
			 electricity produced from certain renewable resources

short-title.#tail:
, such facility shall not be
				treated as a qualified facility for purposes of this section unless such
				facility is 85 percent manufactured in the United States, from articles,
				materials, or supplies 85 percent of which are grown, produced, or manufactured
				in the United States.
